org.araneaframework.http
Interface ThreadCloningContext

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
StandardThreadCloningFilterService
public interface ThreadCloningContext
extends Serializable

Service that clones currently running session thread upon request and sends a response that redirects to cloned session thread. It can be used to support "open link in new window" feature in browsers.

Author:
Taimo Peelo

Field Summary
static String CLONE_ONLY_REQUEST_KEY
          Request parameter key which presence indicates that incoming request is requesting cloning of the current session thread.

          Request parameter key which presence indicates that incoming request is requesting cloning of the current session thread.

Field Detail

CLONING_REQUEST_KEY

static final String CLONING_REQUEST_KEY
Request parameter key which presence indicates that incoming request is requesting cloning of the current session thread. Presence of this should mean that current thread is cloned and then cloned thread is immediately opened in a new browser window.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

CLONE_ONLY_REQUEST_KEY

static final String CLONE_ONLY_REQUEST_KEY
Request parameter key which presence indicates that incoming request is requesting cloning of the current session thread. Presence of this should mean that snapshot of current thread is made before request is routed to child Service. Cloned thread is not attached to thread router (no new window with cloned thread will be opened). Snapshot can be acquired during the same request by calling acquireThreadSnapshot().

Since:
1.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

startClonedThread

String startClonedThread(Relocatable.RelocatableService clone)
Attaches clone as new thread level service (see ThreadContext). It assumes that the service is already initialized and thus will not attempt to reinitialize it (as using ManagedServiceContext.addService(Object, org.araneaframework.Service) would try to do).

Parameters:
clone - cloned service to start as new session level thread
Returns:
identifier of created session thread
Since:
1.1

acquireThreadSnapshot

byte[] acquireThreadSnapshot()
Returns the snapshot of current thread, made before child Service of ThreadCloningContext implementation has had the chance to process the request. Only applicable when request contained either CLONE_ONLY_REQUEST_KEY or CLONING_REQUEST_KEY parameter. Deserialization of the snapshot could be done as follows:

ObjectInputStream ois = new ObjectInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(acquireSerializedThread())); RelocatableService clone = (RelocatableService) ois.readObject();

Snapshot may then be started as cloned thread with startClonedThread(Relocatable.RelocatableService).

Returns:
serialized snapshot of current thread or null
Since:
1.1
